text:
(1) Bird's Eye view of Governor's Island, south from 111 John Street, in Manhattan. July 8, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, as seen from the Manhattan end of Brooklyn Bridge. August 22, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same as view 2, at an earlier date. On the left appear Brooklyn piers. The vantage point is the Brooklyn Bridge. July 23, 1925.

P. L. Sperr.
(No. 3 not a dry mount item).
title: Islands - Governor's Island - Bird's Eye View.

text:
Cliff Street, north from John Street.
April 13, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

John Street (right foreground), east from Cliff to South Streets, showing construction work in progress on the 26-story office building, 111 John Street, which extends from Cliff to Pearl Streets (on which is visible a portion of the South Ferry division of the Second and Third Aves. Elevated Line). Also seen is a general view northeastward of the surrounding area, showing the East River, the Brooklyn and Manhattan Bridges and the Brooklyn shore line. Late 1928.

105 to 119 John Street, north side, east from but not including Cliff, to and including Pearl Streets. These buildings were demolished in 1928 and on their site was erected a 26-story office building, bearing as its address No. 111 John Street.

Prior to 1928.

Brown Brothers.

(1) A general view, north from 111 John Street, between Cliff and Pearl Streets, showing the Ninth and Sixth Ave., Elevated Lines, in the foreground.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, another view. July 8, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, a more limited view.

P. L. Sperr.
title: General view - [Manhattan - John Street - Between Cliff and Pearl Streets (North).]

text:
111 John Street, between Cliff and Pearl Streets. (general view northeastward).

The Fulton Fish Market and environs as photographed from atop this new 26 story insurance center building. Construction details shown on Fulton Street are for the new East River Tunnel of the Eighth Avenue Municipal Subway.

July 8, 1930

P: L. Sperr
title: General view - [Manhattan - John Street - Between Cliff and Pearl Streets (Northeast).]

text:
A general view, northeast from 111 John Street, between Cliff and pearl Streets, showing part of the Brooklyn Bridge, (extending near Frankfort Street, Manhattan, to Bridge Plaza, Brooklyn, the Manhattan Bridge, (extending from Canal Street, at Third Ave., Manhattan, to Flatbush and Myrtle Aves., Brooklyn) and the Williamsburg Bridge, extending from Delancey Street, Manhattan, to the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn).

July 8, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.
title: General view - [Manhattan - John Street - Between Cliff and Pearl Streets (Northeast).]

text:
(1) A general view, northwest from 111 John Street, between Cliff and Pearl Streets, showing the Municipal Building (at Park Row and Centre Street). July 8, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, another view. July 8, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.
title: General view - [Manhattan - John Street - Between Cliff and Pearl Streets (Northwest) - Municipal Building.]

title: General view - [Manhattan - John Street - Between Cliff and Pearl Streets (Northwest) - Municipal Building.]

text:
111 John Street, between Cliff and Pearl Streets, (general view southward);

A view along Pearl Street and showing to the east numerous small structures. At the right and opposite same is the lower portion of the 22 story building No. 1 Cedar Street. The smokestack of the New York Steam Co., plant appears at the left.

July 8, 1930

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - [Manhattan - John Street - Between Cliff and Pearl Streets (South).]

text:
111 John Street, between Cliff and Pearl Streets, (general view southwestward).

This set of three views forms a panoramic arrangement showing the skyline formed by financial buildings on and surrounding Wall Street. Across same from left to right, the prominent structures are No. 1 Cedar Street, (left foreground), the Wall and Hanover Building, the H. L. Dougherty Building (center of No. 1), the International Telephone Building (flag atop), the National City Building (vault-like top), the Bank of New York Building (ornamentation), the Equitable Trust Co. Building, the Bank of Manhattan Building, the Bankers Trust Co. Building (pyramidal roof), the Irving Trust Co. Building (under construction), the Chase National Bank Building, and the twin Equitable Buildings.

In the foreground are numerous other structures some of which are, in the same order: the aformentioned No. 1 Cedar Street, the 25 story Fire Companies Building (left margin of View 1 and center of View 2), the 12 story Bishop Building and the Federal Reserve Building (right center of View 3). Note in View 1 the partially seen activity where the skyscraper, the 60 Wall Tower will rise.

July 8, 1930
Views 1, 2, 3

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - [Manhattan - John Street - Between Cliff and Pearl Streets (Southwest).]

title: General view - [Manhattan - John Street - Between Cliff and Pearl Streets (Southwest).]

text:
(1)
A general view westward from No. 111 John Street, between Cliff and Pearl Streets, showing prominently (right to left) the Woolworth and Transportation Buildings, at the N.W. and S.W. corners of Barclay Street, respectively. In the background is visible the Hudson River and the New Jersey shore. Building on the extreme right, with the cupola, is the old U. S. Post Office, at the convergance of Park Row and Broadway.

P. L. Sperr.

July 8, 1930.

(2)
The same, slightly northward.

P. L. Sperr.

July 8, 1930.
title: General view - [Manhattan - John Street - Between Cliff and Pearl Streets (West).]

title: General view - [Manhattan - John Street - Between Cliff and Pearl Streets (West).]

text:
111 John Street, between Cliff and Pearl Streets (general view westward).

A view from atop the building at the aforementioned location towards Broadway where the Singer Building appears. To the right and left of same are respectively, the 31 story Liberty Tower and the 26 story City Investing Building. At the left margin appears a portion of the Equitable Building. In the foreground at the left is the 25 story Insurance Central Building (No. 80 John Street) adjoining the darkened 17 and 13 story Woodbridge Building. At the lower right corner appears a portion of the National Board of Fire Underwriters Building.

July 8, 1930

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - [Manhattan - John Street - Between Cliff and Pearl Streets (West).]

text:
99 John Street (left foreground), north side, west from Cliff, to and including Gold Streets, showing the 25-story Insurance Company of North America Building.

1933.

Wurtz Brothers.
